tags.description: View analytical information about advertising. Note: If the current operation_user_account (defined by the access token) has access to another user's Ad Accounts via Pinterest Business Access, you can modify your request to use the current operation_user_account's permissions to those Ad Accounts by including the ad_account_id in the path parameters for the request (e.g. .../?ad_account_id=12345&...).
tags.name: ad_accounts

tags.description: View, create, update, or delete information about boards.
tags.name: boards

tags.description: Manage information about shopping product catalogs and items.
tags.name: catalogs

tags.description: Generating and refreshing OAuth access tokens.
tags.name: oauth

tags.description: View, create, update, or delete information about Pins.
tags.name: pins

tags.description: Read-only information about user accounts associated with a given access token.
tags.name: user_account

post.description: Generate an OAuth access token by using an authorization code or a refresh token. See Authentication for more.

get.description: Get account information for the "operation user_account" - By default, the "operation user_account" is the token user_account. If using Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the "operation user_account". See Understanding Business Access for more information.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of an ad account.
parameters.name: ad_account_id

example.message: Not authorized to access the user account.

403.description: Not authorized to access the user account.

get.description:
Get analytics for the "operation user_account"
- By default, the "operation user_account" is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the "operation user_account".

parameters.description: Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain.
parameters.name: from_claimed_content

parameters.description: Pin formats to get data for, default is all.
parameters.name: pin_format

parameters.description: Apps or devices to get data for, default is all.
parameters.name: app_types

parameters.description: Metric types to get data for, default is all.
parameters.name: metric_types

parameters.description: How to split the data into groups. Not including this param means data won't be split.
parameters.name: split_field

parameters.description: Unique identifier of an ad account.
parameters.name: ad_account_id

example.message: Not authorized to access the user account analytics.

403.description: Not authorized to access the user account analytics.

post.description: Create a Pin on a board or board section owned by the "operation user_account". Note: If the current "operation user_account" (defined by the access token) has access to another user's Ad Accounts via Pinterest Business Access, you can modify your request to make use of the current operation_user_account's permissions to those Ad Accounts by including the ad_account_id in the path parameters for the request (e.g. .../?ad_account_id=12345&...). - This function is intended solely for publishing new content created by the user. If you are interested in saving content created by others to your Pinterest boards, sometimes called 'curated content', please use our Save button instead. For more tips on creating fresh content for Pinterest, review our Content App Solutions Guide. Learn more about video Pin creation.

value.message: Whoops! It looks like you entered an invalid URL. Try creating a Pin again with a valid URL.
Your image is too small. Please choose a larger image and try again.
Sorry, this image is broken. Please pick a different image.

403.description: The Pin's image is too small, too large or is broken

value.message: Board not found.
Sorry! We couldn't find this board section.

an object within a short time window.

429.description:
This request exceeded a rate limit. This can happen if the client exceeds one
of the published rate limits or if multiple write operations are applied to
an object within a short time window.

parameters.name: pin_id

example.message: Pin not found.

get.description: Get a Pin owned by the "operation user_account" - or on a group board that has been shared with this account. - By default, the "operation user_account" is the token user_account. Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id (obtained via List ad accounts) to use the owner of that ad_account as the "operation user_account". In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following Business Access roles on the ad_account: - For Pins on public or protected boards: Owner, Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager. - For Pins on secret boards: Owner, Admin.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a Pin.
parameters.name: pin_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of an ad account.
parameters.name: ad_account_id

example.message: You are not permitted to access that resource.

403.description: Not authorized to access board or Pin.

example.message: Pin not found.

get.description: Get analytics for a Pin owned by the "operation user_account" - or on a group board that has been shared with this account. - By default, the "operation user_account" is the token user_account. Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id (obtained via List ad accounts) to use the owner of that ad_account as the "operation user_account". In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following Business Access roles on the ad_account: - For Pins on public or protected boards: Admin, Analyst. - For Pins on secret boards: Admin.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a Pin.
parameters.name: pin_id

get.description:
Get a list of the boards owned by the "operation user_account" + group boards where this account is a collaborator

Optional: Specify a privacy type (public, protected, or secret) to indicate which boards to return.
- If no privacy is specified, all boards that can be returned (based on the scopes of the token and ad_account role if applicable) will be returned.

parameters.name: bookmark

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on Pagination for more information.
parameters.name: page_size

post.description: Register your intent to upload media The response includes all of the information needed to upload the media to Pinterest. To upload the media, make an HTTP POST request (using curl, for example) to upload_url using the Content-Type header value. Send the media file's contents as the request's file parameter and also include all of the parameters from upload_parameters. Learn more about video Pin creation.

get.description: Get details for a registered media upload, including its current status. Learn more about video Pin creation.

parameters.description: Media identifier
parameters.name: media_id

example.message: Media upload not found

parameters.name: bookmark

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on Pagination for more information.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Include shared ad accounts
parameters.name: include_shared_accounts

get.description: Get analytics for the specified ad_account_id, filtered by the specified options. - The token's user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via Business Access: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of an ad account.
parameters.name: ad_account_id

parameters.description: Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description:
Columns to retrieve. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile's currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it's microdollars. Otherwise, it's in microunits of the advertiser's currency.
For example, if the advertiser's currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).
If a column has no value, it may not be returned
parameters.name: columns

parameters.description: Granularity
parameters.name: granularity

parameters.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `30` days.
parameters.name: click_window_days

parameters.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `30` days.
parameters.name: engagement_window_days

parameters.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `1` day.
parameters.name: view_window_days

parameters.description: The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event.
parameters.name: conversion_report_time

example.message: Invalid ad account analytics parameters.

parameters.name: ad_account_id

parameters.description: List of Campaign Ids to use to filter the results.

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on Pagination for more information.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description:

by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Cursor used to fetch the next page of items
parameters.name: bookmark

get.description: This returns a URL to an analytics report given a token returned from the post request report creation call. You can use the URL to download the report and it's valid for an hour. - The token's user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via Business Access: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.

query_campaign_ids.name: campaign_ids

query_campaign_ids_required.description: List of Campaign Ids to use to filter the results.
query_campaign_ids_required.name: campaign_ids

query_columns.description:
Columns to retrieve. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile's currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it's microdollars. Otherwise, it's in microunits of the advertiser's currency.
For example, if the advertiser's currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).
If a column has no value, it may not be returned
query_columns.name: columns

query_conversion_attribution_click_windo.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `30` days.
query_conversion_attribution_click_windo.name: click_window_days

query_conversion_attribution_engagement_.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `30` days.
query_conversion_attribution_engagement_.name: engagement_window_days

query_conversion_attribution_view_window.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `1` day.
query_conversion_attribution_view_window.name: view_window_days

query_conversion_attribution_conversion_.description: The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event.
query_conversion_attribution_conversion_.name: conversion_report_time

query_end_date.description: Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD
query_end_date.name: end_date

query_from_claimed_content.description: Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain.
query_from_claimed_content.name: from_claimed_content

query_metric_types.description: Metric types to get data for, default is all.
query_metric_types.name: metric_types

query_pin_analytics_metric_types.description: Pin metric types to get data for, default is all.
query_pin_analytics_metric_types.name: metric_types

query_split_field_user_account.description: How to split the data into groups. Not including this param means data won't be split.
query_split_field_user_account.name: split_field

query_split_field_pins.description: How to split the data into groups. Not including this param means data won't be split.
query_split_field_pins.name: split_field

query_order.description:
The order in which to sort the items returned: ASCENDING or DESCENDING
by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items.
query_order.name: order

query_page_size.description: Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on Pagination for more information.
query_page_size.name: page_size

query_pin_format.description: Pin formats to get data for, default is all.
query_pin_format.name: pin_format

query_product_group_ids_required.description: List of Product group Ids to use to filter the results.
query_product_group_ids_required.name: product_group_ids

query_start_date.description: Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD
query_start_date.name: start_date

query_token_required.description: Token returned from the post request creation call
query_token_required.name: token

query_translate_interests_to_names.description: Return interests as text names (if value is true) rather than topic IDs.
query_translate_interests_to_names.name: translate_interests_to_names

CatalogsFeedCredentials.description: Use this if your feed file requires username and password.

time.description: A time in format HH:MM with leading 0 (zero)

default_locale.description: The locale used within a feed for product descriptions.

location.description: The URL where a feed is available for download. This URL is what Pinterest will use to download a feed for processing.

ConversionReportAttributionType.description: Attribution type. Refers to the Pinterest Tag endpoints

example.description: Casual fit denim shirt made with the finest quality Japanese denim.
example.title: Womens denim shirt, large

ad_link.description: Allows advertisers to specify a separate URL that can be used to track traffic coming from Pinterest shopping ads. Must send full URL including trackingdo not send tracking parameters only. At this time we do not support impression tracking. Must begin with http:// or https://.

additional_image_link.description: The links to additional images for your product. Up to five additional images can be used to show a product from different angles or to show different stages. Separate each additional image with a comma. We recommend enclosing the whole string with quotes. Must begin with http:// or https://

adult.description: Set this attribute to TRUE if you're submitting items that are considered adult. These will not be shown on Pinterest.

age_group.description: The age group to apply a demographic range to the product. Must be one of the following values: newborn, infant, toddler, kids, adult.

availability.description: The availability of the product. Must be one of the following values: in stock, out of stock, preorder.

average_review_rating.description: Average reviews for the item. Can be a number from 1-5.

color.description: The primary color of the product.

condition.description: The condition of the product. Must be one of the following values: new, used, refurbished.

description.example: Casual fit denim shirt made with the finest quality Japanese denim.

free_shipping_label.description: The item is free to ship.

free_shipping_limit.description: The minimum order purchase necessary for the customer to get free shipping. Only relevant if free shipping is offered.

gender.description: The gender associated with the product. Must be one of the following values: male, female, unisex.

google_product_category.description: The categorization of the product based on the standardized Google Product Taxonomy. This is a set taxonomy. Both the text values and numeric codes are accepted.

id.description: The user-created unique ID that represents the product. Only Unicode characters are accepted.

image_link.description: The link to the main product images. Images should be at least 75x75 pixels to avoid errors. Use the additional_image_link field to add more images of your product. The URL of your image_link must be accessible by the Pinterest user-agent, and send the accurate images. Please make sure there are no template or placeholder images at the link. Must start with http:// or https://

item_group_id.description: The parent ID of the product.

last_updated_time.description: The millisecond timestamp when the item was lastly modified by the merchant.

link.description: The landing page for the product.

material.description: The material used to make the product.

min_ad_price.description: The minimum advertised price of the product. It supports the following formats, "19.99 USD", "19.99USD" and "19.99". If the currency is not included, we default to US dollars.

mobile_link.description: The mobile-optimized version of your landing page. Must begin with http:// or https://.

mpn.description: Manufacturer Part Number are alpha-numeric codes created by the manufacturer of a product to uniquely identify it among all products from the same manufacturer.

number_of_ratings.description: The number of ratings for the item.

number_of_reviews.description: The number of reviews available for the item.

pattern.description: The description of the pattern used for the product.

price.description: The price of the product. It supports the following formats, "24.99 USD", "24.99USD" and "24.99". If the currency is not included, we default to US dollars.

product_type.description: The categorization of your product based on your custom product taxonomy. Subcategories must be sent separated by  > . The > must be wrapped by spaces. We do not recognize any other delimiters such as comma or pipe.

sale_price.description: The discounted price of the product. The sale_price must be lower than the price. It supports the following formats, "14.99 USD", "14.99USD" and "14.99". If the currency is not included, we default to US dollars.

shipping.description: Shipping consists of one group of up to four elements, country, region, service (all optional) and price (required). All colons, even for blank values, are required.

shipping_height.description: The height of the package needed to ship the product. Ensure there is a space between the numeric string and the metric.

shipping_weight.description: The weight of the product. Ensure there is a space between the numeric string and the metric.

shipping_width.description: The width of the package needed to ship the product. Ensure there is a space between the numeric string and the metric.

size_system.description: Indicates the countrys sizing system in which you are submitting your product.

size_type.description: Additional description for the size. Must be one of the following values: regular, petite, plus, big_and_tall, maternity.

tax.description: Tax consists of one group of up to four elements, country, region, rate (all required) and tax_ship (optional). All colons, even for blank values, are required.

ItemBatchRecord.description: Object describing an item batch record

attributes.title: Womens denim shirt, large

Language.description: Language code, which is among the offical ISO 639-1 language list.

MediaUpload.description: Media upload that has been registered but not uploaded/processed yet.
MediaUpload.title: Media upload

OauthAccessTokenRequest.description: Describes the valid schema for possible OAuth access token requests.
OauthAccessTokenRequest.title: OAuth access token request

OauthAccessTokenRequestRefresh.description: A request to exchange a refresh token for a new access token.
OauthAccessTokenRequestRefresh.title: refresh_token

OauthAccessTokenRequestCode.description: A request to exchange an authorization code for an access token.
OauthAccessTokenRequestCode.title: authorization_code

OauthAccessTokenResponse.description: A successful OAuth access token response.
OauthAccessTokenResponse.title: OAuth access token response

OauthAccessTokenResponseCode.description: A successful OAuth access token response for the authorization code flow.
OauthAccessTokenResponseCode.title: OAuth access token response

OauthAccessTokenResponseRefresh.description: A successful OAuth access token response for the refresh token flow.
OauthAccessTokenResponseRefresh.title: OAuth access token response

board_id.description: The board to which this Pin belongs.

board_section_id.description: The board section to which this Pin belongs.

ProductAvailabilityType.description: Default availability for products in a feed.

PRODUCT_GROUP_ID.description: The ID of the product group that this metrics belongs to.

DATE.description: Current metrics date. Only returned when granularity is a time-based value (`DAY`, `HOUR`, `WEEK`, `MONTH`)

order_line_id.description: Order line ID that appears on the invoice.

start_time.description: Campaign start time. Unix timestamp in seconds. Only used for Campaign Budget Optimization (CBO) campaigns.

end_time.description: Campaign end time. Unix timestamp in seconds. Only used for Campaign Budget Optimization (CBO) campaigns.

TrackingUrls.description: Third-party tracking URLs. Up to three tracking URLs are supported for each event type. Tracking URLs set at the ad group or ad level can override those set at the campaign level. For more information, see Third-party and dynamic tracking.

metrics.description: The metric name and daily value for each requested metric

ad_group_id.description: ID of the ad group that contains the ad.

android_deep_link.description: Deep link URL for Android devices. Not currently available. Using this field will generate an error.

carousel_android_deep_links.description: Comma-separated deep links for the carousel pin on Android.

carousel_destination_urls.description: Comma-separated destination URLs for the carousel pin to promote.

carousel_ios_deep_links.description: Comma-separated deep links for the carousel pin on iOS.

click_tracking_url.description: Tracking url for the ad clicks.

ios_deep_link.description: Deep link URL for iOS devices. Not currently available. Using this field will generate an error.

name.description: Name of the ad - 255 chars max.

ad_account_id.description: The ID of the advertiser that this ad belongs to.

campaign_id.description: ID of the ad campaign that contains this ad.

collection_items_destination_url_templat.description: Destination URL template for all items within a collections drawer.

created_time.description: Pin creation time. Unix timestamp in seconds.

rejected_reasons.description: Enum reason why the pin was rejected. Returned if review_status is "REJECTED".

rejection_labels.description: Text reason why the pin was rejected. Returned if review_status is "REJECTED".

updated_time.description: Last update time. Unix timestamp in seconds.

budget_in_micro_currency.description: Budget in micro currency. This field is **REQUIRED** for non-CBO (campaign budget optimization) campaigns.  A CBO campaign automatically generates ad group budgets from its campaign budget to maximize campaign outcome. A CBO campaign is limited to 70 or less ad groups.

bid_in_micro_currency.description: Bid price in micro currency. This field is **REQUIRED** for the following campaign objective_type/billable_event combinations: AWARENESS/IMPRESSION, CONSIDERATION/CLICKTHROUGH, CATALOG_SALES/CLICKTHROUGH, VIDEO_VIEW/VIDEO_V_50_MRC.

budget_type.description: Budget type. If DAILY, an ad group's daily spend will not exceed the budget parameter value. If LIFETIME, the end_time parameter is **REQUIRED**, and the ad group spend is spread evenly between the ad group `start_time` and `end_time` range. A CBO campaign automatically generates ad group budgets from its campaign budget to maximize campaign outcome.

start_time.description: Ad group start time. Unix timestamp in seconds. Defaults to current time.

end_time.description: Ad group end time. Unix timestamp in seconds.

targeting_spec.description: Ad group targeting specification defining the ad group target audience. For example, '{"APPTYPE":["iphone"], "GENDER":["male"], "LOCALE":["en-US"], "LOCATION":["501"], "AGE_BUCKET":["25-34"]}'

lifetime_frequency_cap.description: Set a limit to the number of times a promoted pin from this campaign can be impressed by a pinner within the past rolling 30 days. Only available for CPM (cost per mille (1000 impressions)) ad groups. A CPM ad group has an IMPRESSION billable_event value. This field **REQUIRES** the `end_time` field.

tracking_urls.description:
Third-party tracking URLs.
JSON object with the format: {"Tracking event enum":[URL string array],...}
For example: {"impression": ["URL1", "URL2"], "click": ["URL1", "URL2", "URL3"]}.
Up to three tracking URLs are supported for each event type. Tracking URLs set at the ad group or ad level can override those set at the campaign level. May be null. Pass in an empty object - {} - to remove tracking URLs.

For more information, see Third-party and dynamic tracking.

auto_targeting_enabled.description: Enable auto-targeting for ad group. Also known as "expanded targeting".

pacing_delivery_type.description: Pacing delivery type. With ACCELERATED, an ad group budget is spent as fast as possible. With STANDARD, an ad group budget is spent smoothly over a day.

feed_profile_id.description: Feed Profile ID associated to the adgroup.

campaign_id.description: Campaign ID of the ad group.

created_time.description: Ad group creation time. Unix timestamp in seconds.

updated_time.description: Ad group last update time. Unix timestamp in seconds.

username.description: Public username for the user account

start_date.description: Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD

end_date.description: Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD

granularity.description:
TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.
DAY - metrics are broken down daily.
HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.
WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.
MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly

click_window_days.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `30` days.

engagement_window_days.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `30` days.

view_window_days.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to `1` day.

conversion_report_time.description: The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event.

attribution_types.description: List of types of attribution for the conversion report

created_time.description: Campaign creation time. Unix timestamp in seconds.

name.description: A human-friendly name associated to a given feed. This value is currently nullable due to historical reasons. It is expected to become non-nullable in the future.

default_locale.description: The locale used within a feed for product descriptions.

location.description: The URL where a feed is available for download. This URL is what Pinterest will use to download a feed for processing.

MediaUpload_allOf_upload_parameters.description: The list of parameter key/value pairs you will need to send with your POST request to upload your media file.

media_id.description: Unique identifier for this media upload. Used to track status and for attaching during Pin creation.

upload_url.description: The URL where you will POST your media file.

scopes.ads:read: See all of your advertising data, including ads, ad groups, campaigns etc.
scopes.ads:write: Create, update, or delete ads, ad groups, campaigns etc.
scopes.boards:read: See your public boards, including group boards you join
scopes.boards:write: Create, update, or delete your public boards
scopes.boards:write_secret: Create, update, or delete your secret boards
scopes.catalogs:read: See all of your catalogs data
scopes.catalogs:write: Create, update, or delete your catalogs data
scopes.pins:write: Create, update, or delete your public Pins
scopes.pins:write_secret: Create, update, or delete your secret Pins
